snippet: A group called While We Are Still Here, composed of longtime neighborhood residents, is documenting the histories of two buildings along Edgecombe Avenue in Manhattan.
abstract: Side Street column; group of activists known as While We Are Still Here, led by author and editor Karen D Taylor, are pushing to preserve legacy of buildings at 555 and 409 Edgecombe Avenue in Harlem; group has been planning series of meetings to preserve history of buildings, and are considering putting up historical markers in area and creating lesson plans that can be used in local schools.
lead_paragraph: A group called While We Are Still Here, composed of longtime neighborhood residents, is documenting the histories of two buildings along Edgecombe Avenue in Manhattan.

headline.print_headline: A Push to Preserve the Legacy of a Harlem Neighborhood
headline.main: A Push to Preserve the Cultural Legacy of Harlem’s Sugar Hill
